duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage daily financial activities in the Department of Gynecology and Obstetrics, including non-sponsored and sponsored accounts.
Assist in the development of the annual Departmental budget and projections.
Responsible for monitoring and reconciling non-sponsored financial reports and exercising control of expenditures.
Process quarterly and annual invoices, including posting sponsored invoices in SAP, quarterly billing incentive bonus supplements, journal entries, and non-payroll cost transfers.
Prepare and process various online check requests, online invoices, travel expense reports, etc.
Assist with processing expense reports and check requests.
Responsible for reconciling departmental accounts on a monthly basis and clearing up any discrepancies.
Manage all iLab requests for the department and add IO #’s as needed.
Work with all departmental staff to provide IT services with updated and accurate budget information.
Responsible for processing large volumes of ISR’s throughout each fiscal year.
Develop efficient electronic and paper recordkeeping systems to track a significantly high volume of electronic and paper payroll transactions.
Responsible for tracking, monitoring, and responding to inquiries from departments.
Draft original correspondence and reports.
Assist in processing all new faculty moving expense payroll supplements and managing the Faculty Compensation Tool.
Assure HR processes new hire paperwork in a timely manner and check payroll record for accuracy.
Oversee all faculty and clinical associates onboarding, process all position requests for ongoing replacement and new positions.
Manage all departmental SuccessFactors myPerformance to notify/train supervisors in using the system.
Assist all departmental employees with E210 timesheet concerns and monitor the E210 submission and approval reports.
Create and terminate accounts when necessary and report changes for budget/billing purposes.
Submit annual Fellowship Survey of Graduate Students and Post-doctorates.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, or related field (Master's preferred)
